page.title: 10Kirkconnel:R.C.& others
page.content: The Roman Catholic church of St.Conal stands in the Main Street. While it bears the same name as the Church of Scotland it does not have the same historical link withn St. Conal. The parish priest, Father Joseph Boland, reports that his congregation has increased recently due to in-coming families. There is not a signficant number of Roman Catholics in the parish so Fthr.Boland is able, in addition to his parish work, to be an R.E. adviser to Catholic Secodary schools in Ayrshire. He also shares this school's chaplaincy with the Rev. Mudaliar. Kirkconnel is also served by an active branch of the Salvation Army who have a meeting hall on the Main Street.The Plymouth Brethern have a church in the village and attracts a small but committed membership.
